column4: I have Xubuntu 9.04 installed on my older computer, but get no sound. Have looked for onboard sound chip to disable in BIOS, but found no such option. Any obvious, simple solution you can think of? Thanks.
do you have a second sound card install
yes my soundcard works fine in Windows XP (dual-boot) and worked also in other Linuxes
sorry I misread your response -- no, I'm not aware of a second sound card, just read a suggestion on the web to disable onboard sound chip
if you go to the xubuntu control center there should be an option in there to configure your soundcard, see if it has the correct sound drivers enable. that would be a good place to start.
thanks
although I can't remember if that option is in the control center or under system on the menu xubuntu. I haven't actually used xubuntu for at least a year.
ok, but where is the controc center found?
it should be under the main menu in xubuntu. let me boot up my live cd of xubuntu on my other pc and see if I can find it for you.
thanks a lot
I only have xubuntu 8.04 and it won't boot on my other pc. My computer hardware is too new for version 8.04 apparently. Sorry can any one else help kva_ with his sound card issues in xubuntu 9.04
ok, thanks anyway
I am downloading xubuntu 9.04 right now.
ok
I am downloading it via bittorrent. It has about 15 minutes to go. hopefully someone can help you get started in the meantime I would repost your question for everyone else too.
ok, thanks, I'll do that
yes my soundcard works fine in Windows XP (dual-boot) and worked also in other Linuxes
I am burning xubuntu 9.04 to CD now. brb
just want to say I'm back
I aplogize, I have to leave, thanks for trying (could someone please tell him I had to leave? thanks)
are you there, I found the way to configure your sound card in xubuntu 9.04
